text: Thanks <@U25C65C3S>. Can you set default menu tree/items/content in code as well?

By defaults not sure what you mean. Using the advanced menus feature in HubSpot would be where the data comes from and the structure. You could have a conditional element that sets the default Array but can be overridden by the advance menu
What I mean is can the menu data be encapsulated in code as well. So for example, if we installed a theme on a fresh HubSpot sandbox, is it possible to populate the default menus per the theme?
That Iâ€™m not sure. You would also need the pages built which goes beyond the scope of the theme

maybe the thread above :point_up::skin-tone-2: might help :man-shrugging::skin-tone-2:
you could just bake the `menu('default')` in there
